content.description:
Boulder up to first bolts while placing gear. Then make it through the overhang reestablishing yourself on a ledge, and clip a bolt. Then you have two (2) choices. Keep following the bolts or use the anchor of "Grande Randonnée Fédérale" if you want to do the whole thing in two (2) pitches (That's what I recommend). From the belay clip a bolt on your right and get the horizontal crack, clip a bolt and head on the right for the homemade bolt...., or follow the bolts to your left to meet "Cat's Ass" witch is 5.10c and kinda runout too.

From the right of the Amphitheatre, its the first route under the overhangs. It's just to the right of "Grande Randonnée Fédérale"
to Camalot #1. There are few bolts on the route.

A test-piece in slab climbing where you will definitely have to perform friction move with no holds. Use the left horizontal to do a tricky mantle to the first bolt and then reach up to a sloper to reestablish yourself at the wide horizontal. Clip a second bolt and climb through an easier but still tricky section passing another bolt. Then, all the holds will suddenly disappear and you will have to trust your feet to get to the next bolts! Un testpiece en escalade de dalles où vous devrez effectuer des mouvements de friction sans prises. Utilisez l'horizontale gauche pour faire un rétablissement délicat à la première vis, puis tendez-vous jusqu'à une pente pour vous rétablir à l'horizontale large. Attachez une deuxième plaquette et grimpez à travers une section plus facile mais toujours délicate en passant devant une autre plaquette. Ensuite, toutes les prises disparaîtront soudainement et vous devrez faire confiance à vos pieds pour atteindre les prochaines plaquettes! Climb to first pitch of Chimere (5.11a) to get to the base of the route. Follow the bolts on the left of the anchor.

Grimpez jusqu'au premier relais de Chimère (5.11a) pour arriver à la base du voie. Suivez les plaquettes à gauche de l'ancrage. 5 bolts + 2-bolt anchor

5 plaquettes + Relais

This classic has a hard start in an awkward left facing dihedral. Climb up and over small roof. Now look for a flake on the right and climb that [easier but tricky gear] or climb the right facing corner above [variation 10b]. Finish easily in a hand crack to a bolted anchor. 100' 
  
 The Arkenstone variation is done by climbing Arkentsone which is the massive traverse across the cliff through a wide horizontal crack. At the end of the traverse, you have to finish on the face that is on your right-hand side and that has bolts on it. I think there are two (2) bolts.  
  
 Pitch 2: 
 Up and left is a short head-wall with another hand crack. Climb this to another anchor on a ledge and the base of 'The Crown'.

About 30' left of the spectacular finger crack of Sceptre.
Micro cams up to #2 Camalot

Bouldery start to a good horizontal, followed by a tough but well protected slab and easy finish. 

Départ avec pas de bloc jusqu'à une bonne horizontale, suivi d'une dalle pas donnée mais bien protégée et une fin facile. 



2nd line of bolts to the right of Sceptre. 

2e ligne de bolts à droite de Sceptre. 

7 bolts + Anchor

Start right of "Sceptre" underneath a high bolt (Stick clip). Climb on the lower slab trending left to some gastons. Delicately move toward the bolt on small holds. Get reestablished to the right of the first bolt and clip the second one. Pull a hard move to get to the next bolt. Finish on "Sortie Côté Surplomb"

To the right of "Sceptre"
Three (3) bolts. Bring gear to Camalot 1 if you want to finish on "Sortie Côté Surplomb"

A good exercise in slab climbing. It’s very well bolted route that packs a few different short cruxes. Un bon exercice sur dalle. C'est une voie très bien protégée qui comporte quelques courts crux différents. This is the bolted line to the left of Imperial.

La voie protégée à gauche d'Impérial. 10 bolts

A clean, arching, finger crack. Followed by a slabby traverse left, and then up right the final short crack. Bolted Anchor Rappel easily done with a 60 metre rope Right in front of a bench near the sign labelled "imperiale" BETA WARNING

The crack itself protects excellently (25 feet), however, when making the traverse left (15 feet) there is practically no opportunity to protect. The end of the route is easier and can be protected easily.

The route can take a number 3 bd camalot at the start, but the crack itself will take finger size gear, and in a few places it can take something a bit larger.

Start as Sceptre, all the way to the roof, then traverse right to gain the overhanging crack!

Same as Sceptre
to Camalot #2 plus extra finger size pieces. There is a fixed anchor.

Start as Sceptre, all the way to the roof, then follow the two (2) bolts for a direct spicy finish!

Same as Sceptre
to Camalot #2 plus extra finger size pieces. There are two (2) bolts on the route and a fixed anchor.

A short 3 bolt start left of Chimère on the dihedral.
2 bolts to the roof (#3 Camalot optional) ground fall potential while clipping. Hard boulder problem.

Un départ court avec 3 plaquettes à gauche du coin de Chimère .
2 plaquettes jusqu'au toit (Camalot #3 optionnel), risque de chute au sol en clippant. Problème de bloc difficile.

Camalot #3.

climbs.name: Éclipse
climbs.fa: Paul Laperriere,  Didier Mazoin, Christiane Lelievre, April 6 1980

content.description:
Same start as Sceptre. Bring a .5 C4 to protect the moves to the first bolt. Climb beautiful rock past 4 bolts, finish by climbing a little headwall [easy, cam possible] past another bolt to an anchor.

5 bolts .3-.5 Camalots. Bolted anchor

Fairly sunny, the cliff practically faces south. Once you are on the rock you are exposed to the sun, below there are trees which almost always offer shade.

Assez ensoleillée, la falaise est pratiquement orientée vers le sud. Une fois que vous êtes sur le rocher, vous êtes exposé au soleil, en dessous il y a des arbres qui offrent presque toujours de l'ombre.

Areas from Left to Right:
Amphitheatre
Zébrée
Impériale
Crown (Above Impériale)
Profil Grec (Above Sceptre)
Traversée
Vallot
Staircase
